text.0: i yoke with prayer your ancient inspiration may the laud rise as on the princes pathway.
text.1: all sons of immortality shall hear it all the possessors of celestial natures.
text.2: when speeding ye came nigh us like twin sisters religioushearted votaries brought you forward.
text.3: take your place ye who know your proper station be near be very near unto our soma.
text.4: five paces have i risen from earth i follow her who hath four feet with devout observance.
text.5: this by the sacred syllable have i measured i purify in the central place of order.
text.6: he for gods sake chose death to be his portion he chose not for mens good a life eternal.
text.7: they sacrificed bṛhaspati the Ṛṣi yama delivered up his own dear body.
text.8: the seven flow to the youth on whom the maruts wait the sons unto the father brought the sacrifice.
text.9: both these are his as his they are the lords of both both toil belonging unto both they prosper well.
